BMKG: Hujan Lebat Masih Terjadi sampai 3 November
01 Nov 2019, 21:30 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi hujan. (CNN Indonesia/Bisma Septalisma).

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Badan Meteorologi, Klimatologi, dan Geofisika (BMKG) memperkirakan potensi hujan lebat hingga angin kencang masih berlangsung sampai 3 November 2019 di beberapa wilayah di Indonesia.BMKG mencatat pada Sabtu (2/11) esok, wilayah yang berpotensi hujan lebat disertai angin kencang yaitu Aceh, Sumatera Selatan, Kepulauan Bangka Belitung, Jawa Barat, Jabodetabek, Kalimantan Selatan dan Papua.Pada Minggu (3/11), wilayah yang berpotensi hujan lebat disertai angin kencang yaitu Aceh, Jawa Barat, Jabodetabek, dan Papua."Besok (2/11) wilayah yang berpotensi hujan lebat ialah Sumatera Utara, Riau, Lampung, Jawa Tengah, Jawa Timur, Nusa Tenggara Barat, Kalimantan Utara, dan Kalimantan Timur," tulis Bagian Hubungan Masyarakat Biro Hukum dan Organisasi BMKG melalui keterangan rilis yang diterima CNNIndonesia.com, Jumat (1/11).Selain itu, BMKG juga mencatat pada Minggu (3/11) wilayah yang berpotensi hujan lebat yaitu Sumatera Utara, Riau, Lampung, Jawa Tengah, Kalimantan Utara, dan Kalimantan Timur.Potensi turun hujan lebat menurut BMKG, terdapat intrusi massa udara kering dari Belahan Bumi Selatan (BBS) yang melintasi wilayah Samudera Hindia Selatan Jawa."Di depan muka intrusi, kondisi massa udara akan menjadi lebih lembab dan mendukung potensi konveksi (pergerakan molekul-molekul pada cairan atau gas) kuat," terang BMKG.Sedangkan daerah yang memiliki potensi konvektif (awan yang bergerak secara vertikal dalam atmosfer) dari faktor lokal dengan nilai indeks liabilitas atmosfer sedang atau kuat berada di Riau, Jambi, Belitung, Lampung, Bali, NTB, NTT, sebagian besar Kalimantan, Sulawesi bagian selatan, Maluku Utara, dan Maluku.BMKG mengimbau kepada masyarakat yang tinggal di wilayah yang berpotensi hujan lebat hingga angin kencang untuk berhati-hati, ketika sedang beraktivitas di luar ruangan. (din/lav)

BMKG: Heavy Rain Still Happens until 3 November
01 Nov 2019, 21:30 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of rain. (CNN Indonesia / Bisma Septalisma).

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The Meteorology, Climatology and Geophysics Agency (BMKG) estimates that the potential for heavy rains to strong winds will continue until November 3, 2019 in several regions in Indonesia. BMKG noted on Saturday (2/11) tomorrow, areas that have the potential to rain accompanied by strong winds namely Aceh, South Sumatra, Bangka Belitung Islands, West Java, Jabodetabek, South Kalimantan and Papua. On Sunday (3/11), areas with high rainfall potential include strong winds namely Aceh, West Java, Jabodetabek, and Papua "Tomorrow (2/11) areas with potential heavy rain are North Sumatra, Riau, Lampung, Central Java, East Java, West Nusa Tenggara, North Kalimantan, and East Kalimantan," wrote the Public Relations Section of the Legal Bureau and BMKG Organization through information release received by CNNIndonesia.com, Friday (1/11). In addition, BMKG also noted on Sunday (3/11) areas with potential heavy rain, namely North Sumatra, Riau, Lampung, Central Java, Kalimantan Uta ra, and East Kalimantan. Potential heavy rain according to BMKG, there is an intrusion of dry air masses from the Southern Hemisphere (BBS) that crosses the South Indian Ocean region of Java. "In front of the intrusion face, the condition of the air mass will become more humid and support the potential for convection (the movement of molecules in liquids or gases) is strong, "explained BMKG. While regions that have convective potential (clouds that move vertically in the atmosphere) from local factors with moderate or strong atmospheric liability index values are in Riau, Jambi, Belitung, Lampung, Bali, NTB, NTT, most of Kalimantan, southern Sulawesi, North Maluku, and Maluku. BMKG appealed to people who live in areas with potential heavy rain to strong winds to be careful when doing outdoor activities. (din / lav)
